Great for code review
comment: I doubt I'll submit much code from my phone or even tablet but awesome for peer reviews and code browsing.

title: Unusable for all but the most basic setup
comment: Apparently there is some functionality in this app somewhere, but it is well-hidden behind blank screens and opaque menus. Want to add an SSH key? Hope you have 4 other apps to generate one and put it where this one expects it to be, because it sure isn't going to help you. Using ssh with a passphrase and two-factor auth? Good luck guessing what this app means when it complains while connecting and begs you for a "username and password" -- to what? Who knows, and it sure isn't going to tell you. I guess this might work if you just set up your GitHub with default options yesterday, but to me it was just a frustrating waste of a half hour.

Perhaps I just don't understand this app, but that just means that the app is not intuitive.

title: Competent GIT client.
comment: This is a competent Git client, and comes with an editor for making changes to a repository. I tend to use it more for monitoring a repo than working on one, in which role it excels. Diffs are colourful, and it uses Gravatar. Of course, since it syncs the file to local storage, this is a handy offline Git client, useful with services like Github or Bitbucket when you know in advance that their native app won't be able to connect.  There are a couple of minor irritations. Dates are always displayed in the US format, despite my system-wide preference for UK format. Additionally, while syntax highlighting is available in the file viewer, you must explicitly select the language every time you open a file for viewing. It doesn't use the file extension, and it doesn't remember previous choices.  Secure shell works well, but you'd have to bear in mind that if you're a key user, it can't use password protected keys (as I write).  All in all, I'm happy with this, and it's great for code review.

title: Needs instructions for ssh
comment: The app looks good overall, but I haven't been able to use it as much as I'd like because all of my repos require ssh keys to access. I can't get the private key functionality to work and I can't find instructions for it anywhere -- even basic instructions. With no idea how to use this feature I've just been throwing random things at it and nothing has stuck so far. Hopefully, if I ever get ssh keys working, I'll be able to explore this app more.

title: Very helpful mobile git management tool.
comment: Allows me to clone, import, checkout a branch, pull, push, review commits, diff commits, edit files, and merge over ssh. My only complaint is the dark gray background color when viewing the diff on a commit. I can't read the print. A white background would be much better. Also, after doing a merge of one branch into another, I was unable to view the diff on the commit. I don't know if it exceeded some threshold size, but, I would like a) better feedback when waiting on a process to complete -- (block the screen, and present 'please wait'), and b) error message log access.  But, this in combination with open VPN, allows me to review code changes from all developers from my Nexus 7 easily.   Thank you!  P.S. Any plans for a conflict resolution merge tool? (Mobile KDiff3?)
